intro.p: Consider the region \mathbf{R} bound by the curves y={{line}}, x={{quad}}.

content.p: Express the area of \mathbf{R} as a (sum of) integral(s) with respect to x.

outtro.p: The area of \mathbf{R} is expresible as \int_{ {{x1}} }^{ {{x2}} } \left( {{f1}} \right) - \left( {{f2}} \right)dx +\int_{ {{x2}} }^{ {{x3}} } \left( {{g1}} \right) - \left( {{g2}} \right)dx = \int_{ {{x1}} }^{ {{x2}} } \left( {{f}} \right)dx +\int_{ {{x2}} }^{ {{x3}} } \left( {{g}} \right)dx.

content.p: Express the area of \mathbf{R} as a (sum of) integral(s) with respect to y.

outtro.p: The area of \mathbf{R} is expresible as \int_{ {{a}} }^{ {{b}} } \left( {{right}} \right)-\left( {{left}} \right)dy = \int_{ {{a}} }^{ {{b}} } \left( {{poly}} \right)dy
